Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown-coloured ribbed pottery vessel, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with an almost black resinous deposit, exterior covered with a brown-coloured slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now worn in places, and containing an order for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.146)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87663) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87663)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 183 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
